>>38009589

You'd like to berate them both for acting like babies--but you're not sure you understand the situation fully, and now isn't the time. You'll have another chance. Right now, you want this over.

Liza moves forward, clearing your blade at lightning speed; Anaximander ducks low and moves gracefully, hair twirling, loose robes fluttering.

> [[ 89 ]]

Right into your path. You're not sure he was expecting your attack, but moves to correct himself in the moment it takes you to free your sword from the earth. There's a loud clang, and he's holding the blade back. A pair of armored gauntlets, and he's strong, but you can see the steel against his bare chest, where you've drawn blood.

"Damnit, you!" He pushes back, hitting the ground immediately with another backwards somersault to avoid Liza's next attack. Anaximander is barely back on his feet for an instant before a blast of golden light from Eunoia, flying nearby, cuts a lock of hair from his head. Your party's joining in. They're following you into battle, against who you can only assume is one of the strongest players in the game, and it's working. He can't find the room to swing his sword.

"Six of you?" Anaximander laughs, running towards the opposite wall, using his weapon to keep distance. "Really?"

> [[ Continued ]]
